snippet: Mauritania abolished slavery decades ago, but by some measures, it still has the highest prevalence of the practice in the world, and the government has created an agency to wipe out “vestiges” of the problem.
abstract: Hamdi Ould Mahjoub, director of new Mauritanian agency created to wipe out slavery in the country, says that no instances of the practice have turned up since he started work; country by some measures has the highest prevalence of slavery in the world; antislavery activists dismiss the new agency as 'nothing but smoke and mirrors.'
lead_paragraph: Mauritania abolished slavery decades ago, but by some measures, it still has the highest prevalence of the practice in the world, and the government has created an agency to wipe out “vestiges” of the problem.

headline.main: Mauritania Confronts Long Legacy of Slavery
